parameters.text:
={{ 
[
  "USER_REQUEST:",
  ($json.user_message || "").toString(),
  "",
  "RUNTIME:",
  JSON.stringify({
    tool_name: $json.tool_name || "hubspot.leads",
    dry_run: $json.dry_run ?? true,
    session_id: $json.session_id,
    request_id: $json.request_id,
    conversation_id: $json.conversation_id,
    lead_id: $json.lead_id,
    contact_id: $json.contact_id,
    company_id: $json.company_id,
    deal_id: $json.deal_id,
    user_id: $json.user_id,
    caller_workflow_id: $json.caller_workflow_id,
    caller_execution_id: $json.caller_execution_id
  }, null, 2),
  "",
  "CONTEXT_PACK (DB):",
  JSON.stringify($json.context_pack ?? {}, null, 2)
].join("\n")
}}

options.systemMessage:
You are the HubSpot LEADS Agent.

Your job:
- Manage HubSpot leads: list, search, create, update, delete, merge, batch operations.
- Manage lead associations to contacts, companies, and deals.
- Track lead property history and lead scoring.
- Return ONLY valid JSON in the specified output schema.

INPUTS YOU RECEIVE:
- USER_REQUEST (plain text)
- RUNTIME (json): includes tool_name, dry_run, ids
- CONTEXT_PACK (json): database context if available

HARD RULES:
1) Always use tools for factual data. Do NOT guess.
2) DRY RUN ENFORCEMENT:
   - If runtime.dry_run is true: DO NOT call ANY write tools (Create, Update, Delete, Merge, Associate, Batch writes).
   - If the user requests a write and dry_run=true: return a proposed plan + exact tool + payload, but do not execute.
3) If a required argument is missing (ex: leadId, email, hs_lead_status), ask for it in errors[] and do not call the tool.

AVAILABLE TOOLS (USE THESE NAMES EXACTLY):

READ OPERATIONS:
- List All Leads - Get paginated list of all leads
- Get Lead by ID - Get a specific lead by ID
- Search Leads - Search leads with filters
- List Lead Properties - Get all lead property definitions
- Get Lead Property - Get a specific property definition
- Get Lead Property History - Get historical values of lead properties over time
- Get Lead Associations - Get contacts/companies/deals associated with a lead
- Get Lead Association Labels - Get available association types/labels
- List Owners - List all HubSpot owners that can be assigned to leads

BATCH READ OPERATIONS:
- Batch Read Leads - Read multiple leads by ID in one call (max 100)

WRITE OPERATIONS (ONLY IF dry_run=false AND user explicitly requested):
- Create Lead - Create a new lead
- Update Lead - Update lead properties
- Delete Lead - Delete a lead (moves to recycle bin)
- Merge Leads - Merge two leads into one
- Associate Lead - Link lead to contact/company/deal
- Remove Lead Association - Unlink lead from another object

BATCH WRITE OPERATIONS:
- Batch Create Leads - Create multiple leads at once (max 100)
- Batch Update Leads - Update multiple leads at once (max 100)
- Batch Archive Leads - Delete multiple leads at once (max 100)

INTER-AGENT TOOLS (Delegate to specialized agents):
- Call Contacts Agent - Look up contacts, search contacts for a lead
- Call Companies Agent - Look up companies, search companies for a lead
- Call Deals Agent - Look up deals, search deals for a lead
- Call Engagements Agent - Log notes, create tasks, view activity history on leads

COMMON LEAD PROPERTIES:
- hs_lead_status (NEW, OPEN, IN_PROGRESS, OPEN_DEAL, UNQUALIFIED, ATTEMPTED_TO_CONTACT, CONNECTED, BAD_TIMING)
- firstname, lastname, email, phone, company, jobtitle
- hs_lead_source, hs_lead_source_detail
- hubspot_owner_id (assigned owner)
- hs_lead_score (lead scoring value)
- hs_lifecyclestage_lead_date
- hs_lead_conversion_date, hs_converted_contact_id, hs_converted_deal_id
- notes_last_updated, notes_last_contacted
- hs_analytics_source, hs_analytics_source_data_1, hs_analytics_source_data_2

LEAD STATUS VALUES:
- NEW - Brand new lead
- OPEN - Lead is being worked
- IN_PROGRESS - Actively engaging
- OPEN_DEAL - Lead converted, deal created
- UNQUALIFIED - Lead does not meet criteria
- ATTEMPTED_TO_CONTACT - Tried to reach out
- CONNECTED - Made contact
- BAD_TIMING - Not ready now

SEARCH OPERATORS:
- EQ, NEQ, LT, LTE, GT, GTE
- CONTAINS_TOKEN, NOT_CONTAINS_TOKEN
- HAS_PROPERTY, NOT_HAS_PROPERTY
- BETWEEN, IN, NOT_IN

ASSOCIATION TYPES:
- lead_to_contact (default association)
- lead_to_company
- lead_to_deal

OUTPUT FORMAT (RETURN JSON ONLY):
{
  "summary": "short human summary",
  "data": { "any": "tool results or extracted fields" },
  "tool_calls": [
    { "tool": "Tool Name", "arguments": { } }
  ],
  "errors": [
    { "code": "MISSING_ARG|DRY_RUN_BLOCK|TOOL_ERROR", "message": "..." }
  ],
  "notes_to_save": null
}

parameters.toolDescription: List all leads from HubSpot. Returns paginated results. Use query params: limit (max 100), after (pagination cursor), properties (comma-separated list), associations.
Get a specific lead by ID. Include properties param to specify which properties to return. Use propertiesWithHistory for historical values.

Search leads using filters. Body: {filterGroups: [{filters: [{propertyName, operator, value}]}], sorts: [{propertyName, direction}], properties: [], limit, after}. Common filters: hs_lead_status, hubspot_owner_id, hs_lead_source, hs_lead_score.
List all lead property definitions including standard and custom properties. Returns name, label, type, fieldType, groupName, options for enumeration types.
Get details about a specific lead property including options for enumeration properties (like hs_lead_status, hs_lead_source).

Get PROPERTY HISTORY for a lead. Returns historical values showing how properties changed over time. Specify leadId and properties (comma-separated). Great for tracking lead status progression, score changes, owner assignments.
Get associations for a lead. Specify leadId and toObjectType (contacts, companies, deals). Returns associated object IDs and association types.
Get available association types/labels between leads and another object type (contacts, companies, deals). Returns associationTypeId values needed for creating associations.
List all HubSpot owners (users) that can be assigned to leads. Returns id, email, firstName, lastName. Use the id value for hubspot_owner_id property.
Batch read multiple leads by ID. Body: {inputs: [{id: 'leadId'}], properties: ['prop1', 'prop2']}. More efficient than multiple single reads. Max 100 per batch.

CREATE a new lead. Body: {properties: {firstname, lastname, email, phone, company, hs_lead_status, hubspot_owner_id, ...}, associations: [{to: {id}, types: [{associationCategory, associationTypeId}]}]}. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.
UPDATE a lead by ID. Body: {properties: {key: value, ...}}. Can update any writable property including hs_lead_status for status changes, hs_lead_score for scoring. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.
DELETE a lead by ID. Moves lead to recycle bin (can be restored within 90 days). DESTRUCTIVE WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.

MERGE two leads into one. Body: {primaryObjectId: 'leadIdToKeep', objectIdToMerge: 'leadIdToArchive'}. Primary lead is kept, secondary is merged and archived. All associations transferred. DESTRUCTIVE WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.
Associate a lead with another object (contact, company, deal). Body: [{associationCategory: 'HUBSPOT_DEFINED', associationTypeId: number}]. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.
Remove association between a lead and another object. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.
Batch create multiple leads. Body: {inputs: [{properties: {...}, associations: [...]}]}. Max 100 per batch. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.
Batch update multiple leads. Body: {inputs: [{id: 'leadId', properties: {...}}]}. Max 100 per batch. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.
Batch delete multiple leads. Body: {inputs: [{id: 'leadId'}]}. Moves to recycle bin. Max 100 per batch. DESTRUCTIVE WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.

parameters.name: Call Contacts Agent
parameters.description: Call the HubSpot Contacts Agent to look up contacts, search contacts, or perform contact-related operations. Use when you need contact information for a lead.

parameters.name: Call Companies Agent
parameters.description: Call the HubSpot Companies Agent to look up companies, search companies, or perform company-related operations. Use when you need company information for a lead.

parameters.name: Call Deals Agent
parameters.description: Call the HubSpot Deals Agent to look up deals, search deals, or perform deal-related operations. Use when you need deal information for a lead.

parameters.name: Call Engagements Agent
parameters.description: Call the HubSpot Engagements Agent to log notes, create tasks, view activity history, or manage communications on a lead. Use for activity logging and engagement tracking.

parameters.jsCode:
const input = $input.first().json;

const chatText =
  input.chatInput ||
  input.message?.text ||
  input.text ||
  input.body?.message ||
  input.body?.text ||
  '';

return [{
  json: {
    user_message: String(chatText || ''),
    dry_run: true,
    tool_name: 'hubspot.leads',
    session_id: input.sessionId || input.session_id || 'chat_test',
    conversation_id: input.conversationId || input.conversation_id || 'chat_test',
    chat_id: input.chatId || input.chat_id || null,
    user_id: input.userId || input.user_id || null,
    request_id: input.request_id || null,
    caller_workflow_id: input.caller_workflow_id || null,
    caller_execution_id: input.caller_execution_id || null,
    company_id: input.company_id || null,
    contact_id: input.contact_id || null,
    deal_id: input.deal_id || null,
    lead_id: input.lead_id || null,
    hs_portal_id: input.hs_portal_id || null,
    object_type: 'leads',
    object_id: null
  }
}];
